snippet: How to cope with vegetable anxiety, the fear that overtakes a cook when summer’s bounty of vegetables arrives in the kitchen.
abstract: Vegetable anxiety often strikes cooks at this time of year, when summer’s bounty of produce arrives in the kitchen; some cooks who think nothing of grilling a whole chicken or decorating a three-layer cake are daunted, even defeated, by regularly getting a vegetable dish on the table; Brooklyn chef Ronna Welsh teaches workshops on produce management to help her students truly embrace vegetables; recipes offered.
lead_paragraph: How to cope with vegetable anxiety, the fear that overtakes a cook when summer’s bounty of vegetables arrives in the kitchen.

headline.seo: Coping With Summer’s Bounty of Vegetables
